Part 1 of 2I saw a job opening for an Antiques Dealer that pays \displaystyle\${62},{000} per year salary. Assume that a regular work week for this job is \displaystyle{44} hours, and that you will work \displaystyle{50} weeks in a year.
What is the hourly pay for this job? We will answer the question by converting 62,000 per year into dollars per hour.
If we begin with the fraction \displaystyle\frac{{\${62000}}}{\text{year}}, we can multiply by two unit fractions to complete the conversion. What are these fractions? Choose the correct fractions in the calculation below:
\displaystyle\frac{{\${62000}}}{\text{year}}\times
50 years/1 week
1 year/50 weeks
1 week / 50 years
50 weeks/1 year
\displaystyle\times
44 weeks/1 hour
1 hour/44 weeks
1 week/44 hours
44 hours/1 week
Part 2 of 2 Finally, what is the hourly pay for this job?
Hourly pay = dollars/hour
myopenmath.solution:
B: 1 year/50 weeks
C: 1 week/44 hours
28.18
For this job, we know the following conversion facts:
1 year = 62000 dollars
1 year = 50 weeks
1 week = 44 hours
So, we can convert the yearly rate of 62,000 per year into dollars per hour by the following calculation:
\displaystyle\frac{{\${62000}}}{{\color{red}\cancel{{\text{year}}}}}\cdot\frac{{{1}\ {\color{red}\cancel{{\text{year}}}}}}{{{50}\ {\color{blue}\cancel{{\text{weeks}}}}}}\cdot\frac{{{1}\ {\color{blue}\cancel{{\text{week}}}}}}{{{44}\ \text{hours}}}=\frac{{\${62000}\cdot{1}\cdot{1}}}{{{1}\cdot{50}\cdot{44}\ \text{hours}}}
\displaystyle\ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \approx{28.18}\frac{\text{\$}}{\text{hour}}
So, the position pays \displaystyle{28.18} dollars/hour.
